document_title: Irritable bowel syndrome: Causes, symptoms and prevention
subsection_name: hoi-chung-ruot-kich-thich.json_0_What is the Irritable Bowel Syndrome?
subsection_content:
Irritable bowel syndrome (IBS) is one of the most common intestinal diseases, with a prevalence of 5-20% of the population. This syndrome is benign, although not life-threatening, it has a major impact on the patient's quality of life. Irritable bowel syndrome is more commonly diagnosed in women, the female/male diagnosis ratio is about 1.25-2/1, the common age of diagnosis is from 20 to 50 years old, characterized by recurrent abdominal pain. frequent diarrhea, change in bowel habits, feeling of bloating and discomfort in the abdomen. This is a phenomenon of intestinal dysfunction that recurs many times, but when the patient goes to the doctor and does tests, no physical damage is found in the intestine.(1)
Irritable bowel syndrome is divided into four types based on the patient's symptoms. Treatment methods also change accordingly:
Irritable bowel syndrome with constipation; Diarrheal irritable bowel syndrome; Mixed irritable bowel syndrome (with both diarrhea and constipation); Unspecified irritable bowel syndrome
Although no research has determined the specific, direct cause of irritable bowel syndrome. However, food is the cause of irritation to the digestive system, leading to spasms, abdominal pain, and discomfort. Besides, medical research shows a connection between signs of irritable bowel syndrome and food. Therefore, it can be seen that the quality and hygiene of food have a great influence on the disease.
